feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAC Story - use dropdown for Dimension Property
entry.content:
I am using an SAC Story on top of a planning model.

I am wanting to add a dropdown widget for “Country” – which is the property of dimension “Plant”.

The below code, which was added to onInititalization of a page, successfully adds “Plant” members to a dropdown list and defaults to “A001”.

I am now wanting to change the below code to now instead add members of the property “Country”.

But I am not finding the correct API/functions/code to use.

I have found some blogs online but they all relate to using an Analytic Application and not a Story.

Can someone please help with the script?

Thanks

Anton

var dimPlant = Table_1.getDataSource().getMembers("Plant");
for( var i = 0; i< dimPlant.length; i++ )
	{
		Dropdown_Plant.addItem(dimPlant [i].id, dimPlant [i].description);
	}

Dropdown_Plant.setSelectedKey("A001");

entry.title: Data Action and null
entry.content:
Hi
i give here a short example but this thing is complicate me everytime i need to to calculation that in the measure there is null and not 0
i need a way (script or data action to replace null with 0)

I have dimension cost center

Measure 1 - is valid (can be 1 or null -)

Measure 2 - Act 2025

Measure 3 - Bud 2026

The data action need to calculate Bud 2026 as 
Act 2025 * Measure 1

This way only cost center with 1 will appear 

but when i do if in the data action its not taking the null as 0
its oblivious the null

entry.title: IFP OPEX Calculating CCTR Activity Quantities inversely
entry.content:
Dear All,

Could anyone assist me with an issue I’m facing? When I execute the standard code snippet for calculating quantities inversely in OPEX activity cost rate planning, it returns zero values against Cost Center CSTLG Unit A (US).

However, when I run the code I created in my customized model, it returns zero values against the Plant & Maintenance cost center — which I believe is correct, as Driver 5 mainly applies to that cost center.

Why might there be this difference between the standard IFP OPEX content and my customized model execution results?

could anyone of you assist am I doing wrong or am I misinterpretating ?

reusult 

In my case

entry.title: Unit/Currency Display in Table after Data Entry
entry.content: When entering values in a planning-enabled table with Units/Currency displayed in the row axis, the unit/currency not appearing immediately until the table is refreshed. Is this the limitation of SAP Analytics cloud ?

entry.title: SAC Story - Dropdown for property of Date dimension.
entry.content:
While using an SAC Story on top of a Planning Model, and with the help of @nikhil (link below), I am able to successfully add properties of a generic dimension to a Dropdown widget. I am now wanting to do the same for the Date dimension property "CALMONTH".

However, after copying the working code, and where applicable changing it to use the dimension "Date" and the property "CALMONTH", the dropdown remains unpopulated on initialization.  I have tried using a different Date property and also recreated a new model, but I get the same blank Dropdown result each time.

Can anyone please advise where things are going wrong?  Or can anyone please confirm that the below code is working in their environment?

Otherwise failing that, does anyone have another method of populating a Date dimension's property in a Dropdown?

Thanks

Anton

var dimDate = PlanningModel_1.getMembers("Date");
var CALMONTHmemberId = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);

for( var i = 0; i< dimDate.length; i++ )
	{		
		var currentCALMONTH = dimDate[i].properties.CALMONTH;
		if(CALMONTHmemberId.indexOf(currentCALMONTH) === -1 && currentCALMONTH)
			{
			   CALMONTHmemberId.push(currentCALMONTH);
			   Dropdown_CALMONTH.addItem(currentCALMONTH);
			}
	}

 

(Working solution - https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/sac-story-use-dropdown-for-dimension-property/qaa-p/14177305/emcs_t/S2h8ZW1haWx8dG9waWNfc3Vic2NyaXB0aW9ufE1FNldFWDlSNjVLNjF8MTQxNzczMDV8U1VCU0NSSVBUSU9OU3xoSw#M4922567)

entry.title: SAC Story - Date Dimension properties not available in scripting
entry.content:
In an SAC Story, which is using a Planning Model as the source, I am wanting to use the "setDimensionFilter" function on a property of the Date dimension.  However, the selected value is not being passed to the filter.  I have noticed that when I type "Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter(" and then do a Ctrl + spacebar, only "Date" is listed in the available options - ie. the list does not include the likes of "Date.CALMONTH", etc.

This behaviour is only happeing at a particular client.

To replicate the issue I did the follwoing at 2 separate clients:

  • Created a new model - "Start with an empty model"
  • Added a measure "Value"
  • On the Date dimension, I changed the granularity to "Day"
  • Saved the model
  • From "Actions", created new story - Canvas
  • Added Table_1
  • For the page, added onInitialization script: Table_1.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter(
  • Then Ctrl + spacebar

In the one client, the displayed list includes all the system generated properties of the Date dimension.  Eg "Date.CALMONTH", "Date.CALWEEK", etc. (1st screenshot below)

But in the other client system, I just see "Date".  Ie. no additional fields for the properties. (2nd screenshot below).

Both SAC environments are in the same data center - eu10.  And user auths are the same - both Admin rights.

Is there any reason why the Date properties wouldn't be available at the one client?

Rgds

Anton

 

Client #1 - Date properties listed and available for use

 

Client #2 - Date properties not listed and not available for use.

entry.title: How to Transport SAC Models and Import Jobs between Tenants without including the Source Connection
entry.content:
Hi All,

We are performing a migration between SAC tenants.
One tenant is QAS, where the data models are connected to an S4 QAS system, and the other tenant is PRD, where the migrated data models should connect to the S4 PRD system.

The client’s requirement is that in SAC QAS there should only be the S4 QAS connection, and in SAC PRD there should only be the S4 PRD connection.

At the moment, the only working method we found to migrate the models, while keeping their Import Jobs and transformations, is:

  1. Export the model with the source connection from QAS.

  2. Import it into PRD.

  3. Replace the data source in the Import Job with the PRD connection.

  4. Delete the QAS connection imported into PRD.

We are looking for a more efficient approach.

Is there a way to:

  • Redirect the connection during export/import, or

  • Transport Import Jobs (including transformations) without having to export the QAS connection?

Regarding this second point, we found old notes mentioning an object called “Wrangler” that would migrate transformations, but we cannot find this object anymore.
Reference: SAP Community discussion on "Wrangler" object. 

Any guidance or updated best practice would be appreciated.

Thanks

entry.title: How to build single SAC analytic report where each column can have its own version?
entry.content:
Hello, 
I know that my question is a bit tricky SAC because by default, version and date filters are story-level or widget-level, not column-specific.

However, I have a SAC for planning model. the model has several version used during several years I need to create an analytic report with different column where I can filter for each column a different combination.

as my client adds versions from time to time, and I don't know how many years the model can be used, I'd like to avoid endless combination of restricted measures. I'm seeking for something else

for example: budget 2026 vs forecast 2024 then Actual 2024 vs budget 2023.

How can I build such a report (including the java script code)?

Thank you!

entry.content:
Hello Team!

I have an Excel file with 2 sheets, each containing different rows, and I want to import the data from both sheets into a model. Does anyone know how this is possible?

Is there a way to achieve this?

Kind regards,
Ismail

entry.title: Clear Salary outside HireDate and TerminationDate ranges, and calculate per day salary
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need to clear salary, when Date(YYYYMM) dimensions, has values outside of HireDate(YYYY-MM-DD) and TerminationDate(YYYY-MM-DD) dimensions, if the month matches I need to calculate per day salary and calculate accordingly.

I have recreated a similar Test model with similar data and structure, here is my code and approach:

CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/Account], [d/CostCenter], [d/Emp_Status], [d/Employee], [d/LegalEntity], [d/Location]
CONFIG.GENERATE_UNBOOKED_DATA = ON

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "Amount_LC"  // Scope to the specific measure
MEMBERSET [d/Account] = "ACC_017"     // Filter to the specific account
MEMBERSET [d/DataSource] = "DS_PAYROLL"
MEMBERSET [d/Employee] = (BASEMEMBER([d/Employee].[h/EmpStatus], "ACTIVE", "TERMINATED", "TO_BE_HIRED", "INACTIVE"))

// Vectorized conditional assignments using IF-THEN-ENDIF
IF DATEDIFF([d/HireDate], [d/Date], "MONTH") < 0 OR DATEDIFF([d/Date], [d/TerminationDate], "MONTH") < 0 THEN
    DATA([d/Account] = "ACC_017", [d/Measures] = "Amount_LC", [d/DataSource] = "DS_PAYROLL") = 0
ELSE
    IF DATEDIFF([d/HireDate], [d/Date], "MONTH") = 0 AND DATEDIFF([d/Date], [d/TerminationDate], "MONTH") = 0 THEN
        DATA([d/Account] = "ACC_017", [d/Measures] = "Amount_LC", [d/DataSource] = "DS_PAYROLL") = 
            (DATEDIFF([d/HireDate], [d/TerminationDate], "DAY") + 1) / DAYSINMONTH([d/Date]) * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC")
    ELSE
        IF DATEDIFF([d/HireDate], [d/Date], "MONTH") = 0 THEN
            DATA([d/Account] = "ACC_017", [d/Measures] = "Amount_LC", [d/DataSource] = "DS_PAYROLL") = 
                DATEDIFF([d/HireDate], [d/Date], "DAY") / DAYSINMONTH([d/Date]) * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC")
        ELSE
            IF DATEDIFF([d/Date], [d/TerminationDate], "MONTH") = 0 THEN
                DATA([d/Account] = "ACC_017", [d/Measures] = "Amount_LC", [d/DataSource] = "DS_PAYROLL") = 
                    (DATEDIFF([d/Date], [d/TerminationDate], "DAY") + 1) / DAYSINMONTH([d/Date]) * RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC")
            ELSE
                DATA([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Amount_LC")  // Full month
            ENDIF
        ENDIF
    ENDIF
ENDIF

For this code, I got "Too many member combination errors", so please help me if I can take any other approach or ways to correct this. I have avoided FOREACH because of performance issues

entry.title: Optimizing Data Action Script
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

Currently I have working data action script that is running. Approximate time taking for 1 project is 17 sec. Knowing that I have 150 project in the list and that would be too much time.

Is there anyway to optimize the below code attached.

MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "Amount"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_FLOW] = "#"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_AUDIT] = "INPUT_BL"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_BUDGETYEAR] = %P_BudgetYear%
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_BUSINESSLINE] = "NG"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_COSTCENTER] = "1000/#"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_SCENARIO] = "#"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT] = "1-2311052"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = "2023" TO "2035"
//MEMBERSET[d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/SOURCE]="Budgeted Projects"
 
INTEGER @MatrixYears = 11
INTEGER @ProjectLife
INTEGER @USEFULLIFE
INTEGER @Move
INTEGER @count
INTEGER @StartYear
INTEGER @ENERGIZEDYEAR
INTEGER @REMAININGYEARS
INTEGER @DateYear
INTEGER @OffsetYear
INTEGER @KPIIndex
FLOAT @TotalBudget
FLOAT @PCT
FLOAT @LastPct
FLOAT @TotalPctShortfall = 0
FLOAT @TotalCapPctShortfall = 0
FLOAT @CapPct
FLOAT @Spending
FLOAT @UncapBalance = 0
FLOAT @CapAmount
FLOAT @REMAININGBUDGET
VARIABLEMEMBER #Depreciable_Amt OF [d/Account]
VARIABLEMEMBER #Capitilized_Amt OF [d/Account]
VARIABLEMEMBER #uncap OF [d/Account]
MODEL [Investment Plan Model]
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_STRATEGICKPI].[p/Type] = "CAPEX"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_PROJECT] = "#"
ENDMODEL
 
FOREACH [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT]
 
@StartYear = ATTRIBUTE([d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/BUDGETEDYEAR])
@ENERGIZEDYEAR = ATTRIBUTE([d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/ENERGIZEDYEAR])
@USEFULLIFE = ATTRIBUTE([d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/USEFULLIFE])
@ProjectLife = @ENERGIZEDYEAR - @StartYear + 1
 
@TotalBudget = RESULTLOOKUP(
[d/Measures] = "Amount",
[d/Account] = "CAPEX_003",
[d/Date] = [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/BUDGETEDYEAR],
[d/Version] = "public.Actual"
   )
 
// --- Sum extra % beyond project life ---
@TotalPctShortfall = 0
@KPIIndex = 0
 
FOREACH [Investment Plan Model].[d/DIM_STRATEGICKPI].[p/SORT]
IF [Investment Plan Model].[d/DIM_PROJECTTYPE] = [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/PROJECTTYPE] THEN
 
@PCT = LINK(
[Investment Plan Model],
[d/DIM_CAPEX_ACCOUNT] = "CAPEX_SPENDPERCENT",
[d/Date] = "2070",
[d/Measures] = "Value",
[d/Version] = "public.Assumptions",
[d/DIM_AUDIT] = "INPUT_FP",
[d/DIM_SCENARIO] = "#",
[d/DIM_BUSINESSLINE] = "NOBUSINESSLINE",
[d/DIM_COSTCENTER] = "#",
[d/DIM_PROJECTTYPE] = [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/PROJECTTYPE]
   )
@CapPct = LINK([Investment Plan Model], [d/DIM_CAPEX_ACCOUNT] = "CAPEX_CAPPERCENT", [d/Date] = "2070", [d/Measures] = "Value", [d/Version] = "public.Assumptions", [d/DIM_AUDIT] = "INPUT_FP", [d/DIM_SCENARIO] = "#", [d/DIM_BUSINESSLINE] = "NOBUSINESSLINE", [d/DIM_COSTCENTER] = "#", [d/DIM_PROJECTTYPE] = [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/PROJECTTYPE]
  )
 
// If project life < matrix: accumulate leftover % AFTER the project life
IF @KPIIndex >= @ProjectLife AND @KPIIndex < @MatrixYears THEN
@TotalPctShortfall = @TotalPctShortfall + @PCT
@TotalCapPctShortfall = @TotalCapPctShortfall + @CapPct
ENDIF
 
// Capture last matrix pct (last KPI member)
IF @KPIIndex = @MatrixYears - 1 THEN
@LastPct = @PCT
ENDIF
 
@KPIIndex = @KPIIndex + 1
ENDIF
ENDFOR
 
// --- Loop through years ---
FOREACH [d/Date]
 
@DateYear = YEAR([d/Date])
@OffsetYear = @DateYear - @StartYear
// stop after project life
IF @OffsetYear >= @ProjectLife THEN
BREAK
ENDIF
IF @OffsetYear >= 0 AND @OffsetYear < @ProjectLife THEN
 
// Find matching KPI member index to offset year
@KPIIndex = 0
@PCT = 0
@CapPct = 0
FOREACH [Investment Plan Model].[d/DIM_PROJECTTYPE]
IF [Investment Plan Model].[d/DIM_PROJECTTYPE] = [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/PROJECTTYPE] THEN
FOREACH [Investment Plan Model].[d/DIM_STRATEGICKPI].[p/SORT]
IF @KPIIndex = @OffsetYear AND @OffsetYear < @MatrixYears - 1 THEN
@PCT = LINK([Investment Plan Model], [d/DIM_PROJECTTYPE]=[d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/PROJECTTYPE],[d/DIM_CAPEX_ACCOUNT] = "CAPEX_SPENDPERCENT", [d/Date] = "2070", [d/Measures] = "Value", [d/Version] = "public.Assumptions", [d/DIM_AUDIT] = "INPUT_FP", [d/DIM_SCENARIO] = "#", [d/DIM_BUSINESSLINE] = "NOBUSINESSLINE", [d/DIM_COSTCENTER] = "#")
@CapPct = LINK([Investment Plan Model], [d/DIM_PROJECTTYPE]=[d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/PROJECTTYPE],
 [d/DIM_CAPEX_ACCOUNT] = "CAPEX_CAPPERCENT", [d/Date] = "2070", [d/Measures] = "Value", [d/Version] = "public.Assumptions", [d/DIM_AUDIT] = "INPUT_FP", [d/DIM_SCENARIO] = "#", [d/DIM_BUSINESSLINE] = "NOBUSINESSLINE", [d/DIM_COSTCENTER] = "#")
// If last year and project life < matrix, add surplus %
IF @OffsetYear = @ProjectLife - 1 AND @ProjectLife < @MatrixYears THEN
@PCT = @PCT + @TotalPctShortfall
@CapPct = @CapPct + @TotalCapPctShortfall
ENDIF
ENDIF
 
// Case 2: Year is beyond matrix but project life continues → redistribute leftover
IF @OffsetYear >= @MatrixYears - 1 AND @OffsetYear < @ProjectLife THEN
@RemainingYears = @ProjectLife - (@MatrixYears - 1)
IF @RemainingYears > 0 THEN
@PCT = @LastPct / @RemainingYears
ELSE
@PCT = 0
ENDIF
ENDIF
 
@Spending = @TotalBudget * (@Pct / 100)
 
// Add spending to uncapitalized balance
@UncapBalance = @Spending + @UncapBalance
DATA([d/Measures] = "Amount", [d/Account] = "CAPEX_001") = @Spending
DATA([d/Account] = #uncap) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_001") + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = #uncap, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1))
 
// CWIP calculation
DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_012") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_012", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_001")
// Capitalize on total uncapitalized balance
@CapAmount = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = #uncap) * (@CapPct / 100)
 
// If it's the energized year → force capitalize all remaining
IF @DateYear = @ENERGIZEDYEAR THEN
@CapAmount = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = #uncap)
@UncapBalance = 0
ELSE
DATA([d/Account] = #uncap) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = #uncap) - @CapAmount
ENDIF
 
// Store capitalization amount
DATA([d/Measures] = "Amount", [d/Account] = "CAPEX_002") = @CapAmount
 
@KPIIndex = @KPIIndex + 1
ENDFOR 
ENDIF
ENDFOR
ENDIF
 
//         // --- Depreciation ---
//         IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002") != Null THEN
//             @Move = 0
//             FOR @count = 1 TO @USEFULLIFE
//                 DATA.APPEND([d/Account] = #Depreciable_Amt, [d/Date] = NEXT(@Move)) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")
//                 @Move = @Move + 1
//             ENDFOR
//         ENDIF
 
//         DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004", [d/Date] = NEXT(1)) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = #Depreciable_Amt) / @USEFULLIFE
//         DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")
 
//         IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004") != Null THEN
//             DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_005") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_005", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004")
//             DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")
//             DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_006") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) - RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_005")
//         ENDIF
 
//         IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004") != Null OR RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002") != Null THEN
//             DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_015") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_016", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1))
//             DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_016") =
//                 RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_015") +
//                 RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002") -
//                 RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004")
//         ENDIF
ENDFOR
ENDFOR

Thanks.

entry.title: Problem with Popups after SAC Release 2025.14.8
entry.content:
Hi,

after using StoryPopup_1.open(); in onClick() at a button all widgets from that page lose connection to all InputControls from that page and no data is shown anymore.  InputControl values are all inactive. Story needs to be reloaded. 

How does StoryPopup_1.open(); influence an InputControl? Strange behaviour. Please fix that fast.

BR

Alex

iso code is mapped with TW

entry.title: No e-mail notification from SAC calendar tasks when the owner and the assignee are one and the same?
entry.content:
Dear experts, 

In SAP analytics cloud calendar we created a task with owner and assignee one and the same user. 
There is no notification received when the task was activated. For other tasks the same user received notifications , but in case the owner and the assignee are one the same, there is no notification. Is this how the system is designed to work or this is a bug?

Is there a workaround to receive notification?

 

thank you!

entry.title: Data Action to copy from classic model to new model
entry.content:
Hi,

The following data action to copy data from a classic model to new model has errors below. How do I resolve the errors for a working solution?

DATA("SignedData", [d/Date, d/Version, d/GL_ACCOUNT, d/AUDIT_TRAIL, d/BUSINESS_STREAM, d/DEPARTMENT, d/LOCATION, d/SUPPLIER, d/ASSET,d/CAPEX,d/CUSTOMER,d/COMPANY])
= LINK([FINANCE], [d/Date=%pDate%, d/Version=%pVersion%,d/GL_ACCOUNT,d/AUDIT_TRAIL,d/BUSINESS_STREAM,d/DEPARTMENT, d/LOCATION, d/SUPPLIER, d/ASSET,d/CAPEX,d/CUSTOMER,d/COMPANY], "Measures")

1. Mismatching 'SignedData'; expecting ')'

2. Mismatching input ','; expecting '='

Thanks,

Rajash

entry.title: Dynamic Calculated Measure
entry.content:
Hello Team!


I want to create a Calculated Measure that retrieves the total number of employees from the previous month (in this case, 3), adds the number of hires for the current month (in this case, 1), and subtracts the number of terminations (in this case, 2).
I need this Calculated Measure to be dynamic and automatically perform the calculations and fill in the values through to the end of the year.

entry.title: I want to display the “year and month” of the system date in SAP Analytics Cloud.
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Is there a way to display the “year and month” of the system date in text or chart titles in SAP Analytics Cloud?

The system date can be displayed as “year, month, day” in dynamic text, but I would like to display only “year and month.”

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

 

Thanks best regards.

entry.title: I want to freely display the dimensions and measures of the SAC table in a flat format.
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Do you know how to display dimension items and measure items together in SAP Analytics Cloud tables?

When you add dimension items and measure items to the table, the dimension items are grouped together on the left.
The measure items are grouped together on the right. For example, as shown in ②.

We want to display items on the table in a flat state, without dividing them into left and right sides, as shown in ①.

If anyone knows how to do this, please let me know.

Thanks best regards.
